editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Scholars of Merton College.

msItem.note: f. 1 blank; on 1v is a table of contents in a hand contemporary with the main text, and ‘Liber Galieni’, s. xiv.

msItem.author: (Ps.?)-GALEN
msItem.title: De Elementis secundum Hippocratem
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Galieni de secundum Ypocratem elementis.
msItem.incipit: Quoniam elementum minima est particula cuius est elementum minimum
msItem.explicit: qui utique posterius existit uera uiolenter proprio attracto.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Galieni de secundum Ypocratem elementis.
msItem.note: Pr. in Galen, Opera, Venice 1490 (GW 10481), II, fols. 217-35v; TKI 1274 (cf. 1269); HL 135-8.

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: De Complexionibus
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber primus Galieni de complexionibus.
msItem.incipit: Summe que sunt in sermone primi libri Galieni de complexione
msItem.note: Pr. in his Opera, II, fols. 233v-7; TKI 1538.

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: De Malitia Complexionis Diversae
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber de malicia complexionis diuerse.
msItem.incipit: Malicia complexionis diuerse quandoque in toto animalis corpore
msItem.note: Pr. in his Opera, II, fols. 237-8v; TKI 846.

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: De Simplicibus Medicinis
msItem.incipit: Quoniam mihi necesse est hic ostendere summam utilitatis cognitionis
msItem.explicit: in unaquaque medicinarum per se si Deus uoluerit.
msItem.finalRubric: Finitus est tractatus v. libri Galieni in uirtutibus simplicium medicinarum.
msItem.note: Pr. in his Opera, II, fols. 238v-300v; TKI 1285.

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: De Morbo et Accidente
msItem.rubric: Incipit prima particula de accidente et morbo.
msItem.incipit: In inicio huius libri diffiniri morbum oportet
msItem.explicit: semper alia sequuntur et que non.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber de morbo et accidente.
msItem.note: Pr. in his Opera, II, fols. 355-69; TKI 684.

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: Megategni
msItem.incipit: Quoniam intencio gloriossimi G. in hoc libro fuit ad redarguandum quandam sectam
msItem.note: Pr., with the works of Isaac Iudaeus, Lyon 1515, II, fols. 189v-209v; TKI 1163, 1282.

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: De Crisibus
msItem.incipit: Ego non intendo in hoc meo libro determinare
msItem.explicit: et non est necessarius tractatus quartus.
msItem.note: Pr. in his Opera, I, fols. 78-95v; TKI 490.

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: De Criticis Diebus
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber G. de creticis diebus.
msItem.incipit: Vt egritudinum que non paulatim minuuntur
msItem.finalRubric: Ex eius adiutorio completus est tractatus tercius G. de creticis diebus. Explicit tractatus libri tercii G. de creticis diebus.
msItem.note: Pr. in his Opera, I, fols. 96-108v; TKI 1617.

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: De Interioribus
msItem.incipit: Medicorum non solum moderni uerum etiam et antiqui
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Galieni de interioribus membris.
msItem.note: Pr. in his Opera, II, fols. 330-54v; ed. R. J. Durling, Galen Latinus 2 (Stuttgart, 1992); TKI 863.

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: De Virtutibus Cibariorum
msItem.incipit: Dicit G. quod quia corpora hominum sunt in continua dissolucione
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber G. de uirtutibus naturalibus cibariorum translatus per magistrum Acursium Pystoyensem apud Bononias anno Domini mcc.
msItem.note: Pr. in his Opera, II, fols. 162v-5v; TKI 266.
Annotated throughout in anglicana hands of s. xiv and xv.

supportDesc.extent:
215 leaves (iii + 212)
340 230
245-60 150
The edges retrimmed, affecting marginalia, and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: A singleton, 1-38, 4-1812 / 194; catchwords and coloured leaf-numbers. Quire 19 is a slightly later addition to the main book.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 63 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Arts 1-9 in a proficient French gothic rotunda bookhand. The hand of art. 10, perhaps a little later, is more formal.

decoDesc.decoNote: Handsome large initials with foliage in colours and gold fols. 1, 7v, 27v, 77v; red and blue flourished initials; a few small blue initials flourished in red; red or blue paraphs. Art. 10 has unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, repaired and rebacked; sewn on seven bands; formerly chained from the usual position. Fols. i-ii and 211-12 are modern paper blanks, iii and 210 are binding leaves, s. xvii.

history.provenance: French. Near the head of f. 1v is a thoroughly erased inscription. Below is a lengthy table of contents in the usual secretary hand,c. 1500, ending ‘Ex dono domini Ricardi Fitz James nuper Cicestrensis episcopi et custodis istius Collegii cuius anime propicietur Deus amen.’ For Fitzjames, warden 1483-1507, see MS 9.

At the head of f. 2 is the James no. ‘69’, and at the foot ‘Lib: Bib: Merton: Oxon:’, both s. xvii. Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a table of contents, s. xvii, and ‘P. 2. 1. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘N. 3. 1’ and ‘No. CCXVIII’ in red; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, p. 84; Powicke, no. 1191; Alexander & Temple, no. 653.
